chapter.title: User Preferences
chapter.para: Each time you want to launch PMB, you must enter a username and password. This enables PMB to identify you as well as your access privileges within the application (circulation, cataloging, administration...). This username / password combination allows PMB to store a certain number of settings enabling you to have a personalised layout or your own colour scheme.

In short, the user preferences are a set of stored parameters for a user. They are therefore linked to the username entered on the login screen. To view your preferences, click on the link Edit your account parameters at the top right of the screen, near logout.

sect1.title: Password, language, style
sect1.para: Here you can change your password. If you enter a New password, please enter it once again in the Confirmation field.
You can also select another Language. Warning, certain languages require a particular style for optimal display.
You can also change your display style : Style/theme.

sect1.title: Number of records per page
sect1.para: The Number of records displayed on each page can be set for the following screens :

The higher this number, the greater in number the results will be per page, consequently the longer the page will be. If you prefer short pages, reduce these values; if you prefer to display the maximum number of records on a single page, increase them.
The default choice corresponds to the developers' and a system display resolution of 1024x768.

sect1.title: Application's parameters
sect1.para: Automatic pop-up of loan ticket: automatically displays the loan ticket when a new loan is validated.
Play sound alerts: beep, for instance, when an error message is displayed.

sect1.title: I have read and I accept the terms of the PMB licence
sect1.para: Starting with version 1.3 PMB comes with a new licence : the CeCILL licence. This licence is compatible with GNU/GPL. For more information, see http://www.cecill.info
This new licence is displayed when you launch PMB after connection and login (you have entered your username and password.
If you do not wish to display the licence at login, select Don't show the licence when starting.

sect1.title: Application's default values
sect1.para: This part of the screen allows you to specify default values for the creation of new copies :

listitem.para: Borrowers default site (useful when managing a multi-site library with PMB : Borrowers and their locations are specifically defined even at registration)
Default thesaurus (if multi-thesaurus is enabled) defines the default thesaurus in PMB)

sect1.para: This enables you to save cataloguing time.
You can also specify the default values for the creation of new records :

listitem.para: language. By default set to fre, for French. Language codes are defined by the UNIMARC standard. To consult the list of languages and their codes, open the file pmb/includes/marc_tables/en_UK/lang.xmlwith a text editor.

Author function. By default set to 70 for author. The function of an author varies according to the type of work : director for a videorecording of a play, photographer for an album, author for a book, ... Author functions are defined by the UNIMARC standard. To consult the list of author functions and their codes, open the file pmb/includes/marc_tables/en_UK/function.xml with a text editor
